name: Travel_Arrangements.xlsx
data: The policy states that Gartner's Travel Management Company (TMC) is responsible for booking air, lodging, rail, auto rental and ground transportation service arrangements consistent with Gartner's Global Travel and Entertainment Policy.

(i)The company will consolidate travel purchasing through a single travel agency to achieve important benefits: communicate, monitor and enforce the corporate-wide travel policy across all branches and divisions; implement policy changes immediately for all organization employees; provide a uniform level of service to all employees; receive consolidated management information reports; channel all travel to selected vendors to take advantage of negotiated rates; gain leverage with travel suppliers for negotiation purposes by directing volume to preferred vendors; maximize leverage with the agency for service and revenue-sharing negotiations.

Rating is Partial Because: Policy mentions TMC's role but doesn't explicitly state benefits of consolidation through single agency.Content: Need to add benefits of consolidated purchasing like uniform service levels, consolidated reporting, leveraging volume for negotiations.

ONLY published authorized methods for booking business travel are to be used. Associates are specifically prohibited from going directly to airline carrier websites or the internet to purchase airline tickets.

(i)The policy will state that all air, rail, hotel and car rental reservations must be made through the designated agency (and/or Corporate Travel Department).  This will help ensure that travel arrangements comply with company policy guidelines, make travel arrangements easier for travelers, ensure consistent and complete management information, and help direct travelers to preferred vendors.
Travel Booking Instructions and Contact Information

All associates are required to book every business trip via the TMC in one of three ways (no exceptions): 1) by phone with a travel counselor 2) by email with a travel counselor, or 3) online with an authorized online booking tool in regions where this is available.

Booking process and internal contact information are integral to ensuring compliance with policy and cost effectiveness; (i) booking via travel agents ensures compliance with corporate policy and preferred vendors ,however, (ii) automated/on-line travel booking instructions are the most efficient means of communicating with employees. (iii) The policy must mandate that all travel arrangements be made at the same time in the same transaction.
Online booking is not available in all regions. Where it is available, it is the most cost effective way to book simple, point-to-point domestic reservations.

(i) Providing an on-line booking tool and requiring travelers to use it exclusively to book all travel arrangements (air, hotel, car rental) will ensure systematic tracking of all company travel arrangements while providing a knowledge base of an employee's in-transit status.
Internet and/or Supplier-Direct Booking of Travel Arrangements
Associates are specifically prohibited from going directly to airline carrier websites or the internet to purchase airline tickets.

(i) Employees should be prohibited from using internet or any non-designated source for booking any form of travel.  These sources may appear to be more cost effective, but provide no tracking information to management nor do these volumes count towards volume discounts at the corporate level; if the policy allows supplier direct/internet bookings, the policy should mandate the traveler to provide detailed itinerary and contact information for the reservation.
It is important that any 'named fields' in your profile match a valid passport or license with middle name or initial or you will likely encounter travel interruptions.

When passport, travel visas, tourist cards or immunization requirements are necessary, (i) the policy should refer travelers to the appropriate source to ensure that the requirements are met. Generally, this would be the company designated travel agency or Company Travel Services department.  (ii)  The policy should also indicate that the fees are reimbursable if required for business travel.

Rating is Partial Because: Policy mentions passport/travel document matching but doesn't address fees or reimbursement.Content: Need to add that passport/visa fees are reimbursable for business travel.

Traveler Profiles can be accessed online by logging into the preferred online booking tool. You must complete a travel profile in order to make reservations with the TMC. Travelers are encouraged to periodically update their profiles to reflect any changes in information.

The policy states (i) Travelers are required to complete and submit a profile to the designated agency and/or online booking tool for entry into the reservation system detailing preferences and any special status, i.e.., military service, special needs, as preferred rates may apply over and above negotiated corporate rates. (ii)  Travelers will be encouraged to annually update their profiles to reflect any changes in information (seat selection, change of address or department, charge card numbers); the policy will also mandate travelers to include emergency contact information.
Rating is Partial Because: Policy doesn't mandate emergency contact information.Content: Need to add requirement for emergency contact information in profiles.

If you miss a connection OR are on a flight other than that originally ticketed, notify the limo service as soon as possible. Due to complexities of international itineraries, Gartner's online booking tool providers are NOT recommended for complex international ticketing.

The policy states (i) Travelers will be instructed to make all in-transit changes and/or (ii) emergency travel arrangements through the designated travel agency, TMC phone app and/or 24-hour emergency services number ensures employee location is known at all times and more favorable rates are obtained.  Management information reports will capture all updated activity, providing the company with complete and accurate travel management data.  (iii) The toll free number needed to make changes or details of the TMC mobile app must be provided.  Travelers can also be instructed to utilize the toll free number on their itinerary.
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't provide specific emergency contact numbers or TMC mobile app details.Content: Need to add 24-hour emergency contact numbers and TMC mobile app information.
Employee Travel FOR a Client(Client BillableTravel)
Client Billable or Travel for a Client by a Gartner Associate MUST be booked by Gartner's Travel Management Company only (not the client's).
The policy states (i) if special circumstances exist when traveling with customer/clientâ€¦i.e.., allowed to travel in same class of service/accommodation for air, hotel.
Web, Tele & Videoconferencing should be considered as an alternative to travel when travel is not necessary.

The policy states (i) Travelers are be encouraged to examine low-cost travel alternatives, such as tele/video-conferencing; (ii) use of these alternatives in specific circumstances ensures a consistent application of the policy.
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't specify circumstances for using alternatives.Content: Need to add specific situations when video/teleconferencing should be used.
Requests for ALL travel arrangements not in accordance with this Policy are to be escalated to the Global Travel Department by the TMC for review/exception approval prior to ticketing.

The policy states (i)  A form of pre-trip approval/out of policy notification prior to finalization of reservations is required.  (ii) Mandating the use of :A) a travel agency responsible for adherence to company policy , B)  the use of an on-line booking tool with integrated restrictions , or C) pretrip authorization tools at point of sale of is the most effective and cost efficient way to monitor policy.
The Global Travel Department then works with the appropriate Operating Committee member to approve or deny exception requests.
The policy states: (i) A form of pre-trip approval for changes to an itinerary.  Best practice is to require pre-trip approval for any additional charges defined on culture. (i.e., $100,$2500, $500)

An extended stay or temporary assignment is defined as more than 4 weeks away from the employee's regular place of business, at the request of Gartner, for purposes of carrying out Company-related activities.
The policy states (i) The definition of extended stay in terms of number of days away.

The policy states (i) whether employee weekend return trips are allowed;  (ii) the frequency of return trips permitted based on the length of time away and/or class of service for the return trip home.
Rating is Null Because: No information about employee weekend return home.Content: Policy should specify if weekend return trips are allowed and frequency based on assignment length.
The policy must outline whether this practice is allowed; (I) The policy will outline what the spending guidelines/restrictions are for this practice.
Rating is Null Because: No information about weekend side trips.Content: Policy should outline if weekend side trips are allowed and spending guidelines.

Travelers may retain awards from such programs for personal use. Participation in these programs must not influence hotel selection, which would result in incremental cost beyond the company's special negotiated rates. Any membership fees associated with joining these programs are not reimbursable.

(i) The policy indicates whether the employee is permitted to retain the benefits of these programs for personal use; however, the policy will indicate that (ii) under no circumstances may hotel accommodation be selected on the basis of participation in one of these programs; (iii) the policy will also state that membership fees associated with joining these programs are not reimbursable.

Planning travel to include a Saturday night stay sometimes results in significant airfare savings for the company. Gartner will reimburse any additional lodging and meals to obtain a discounted fare for a Saturday night stay provided additional costs are less than lowest fare for weekday travel.

The policy states: (i) Business trips that overlap a weekend (i.e. Friday, Saturday or Sunday night stay) are reimbursable if the total cost of hotel, transportation and meals do not exceed the savings benefit of traveling during a regular business week. (ii) Prior approval is required (iii) The traveler must remain at the same business city to qualify for this reimbursement.
